items.title: Guinea junta chief wins presidential election by landslide
items.description: The victory, which gives the junta leader a seven-year mandate, was widely expected.

items.title: Huge crowds mourn Bangladesh's first female PM at state funeral
items.description: A sea of mourners have gathered in Dhaka to pay final respects to Khaleda Zia, who died on Tuesday aged 80.

items.title: Eurostar services return to normal after major Channel Tunnel disruption
items.description: The high-speed rail firm urged passengers to check before they travel as last-minute delays and cancellations are still possible.

items.title: Heated Rivalry author says TV success led to help with her Parkinson's
items.description: Rachel Reid says the publicity from the hit TV adaptation led a Parkinson's specialist to get in touch.

items.title: Mali and Burkina Faso impose travel ban on US citizens in tit-for-tat move
items.description: The two states say they are taking reciprocal measures after the US announced full-entry restrictions on their citizens.
